chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Clay Konichek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:51 PM Defendant Brandon Clay Konichek in court, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Brandon Clay Konichek.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Getsinger states matters are resolved.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Getsinger acknowledges rec. information/waives reading.  Atty Getsinger states the joint recommendations.  State is in agreement.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea agreement.  DE pleads NC to counts 2 and 4.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim rights and there is no VIS nor any request for restitution.  Atty Getsinger and DE are in agreement w/proceeding today w/o a PSI being ordered.  State notes the DE has 2 other pending cases in 2 other counties.  Atty Getsinger makes sentencing argument.  State makes statement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

22CF368

Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in

Ct 2:  NC
Probation for 3 years consecutive to count 4
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and follow up counseling/treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol
Make all scheduled court appearances
No credit if revoked

Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in

Ct 4:  NC
96 days jail w/o huber privileges - consecutive to any other - to commence FORTHWITH
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
67 days credit to be applied

22FO799 is dismissed
Return date on September 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
